https://github.com/raysan5/raygui.title: raygui: Immediate Mode GUI Library

https://github.com/cegui/cegui.title: Crazy Eddie's GUI Library
https://github.com/cegui/cegui.info: Versatile, fast C++ GUI library for games with modular architecture, minimal dependencies (only GLM required), multi-platform support. Performance: 3000+ FPS in release mode, used in big games like Torchlight 1&2.

https://martin-fieber.de/blog/gui-develo.title: GUI Development with C++, SDL2, and Dear ImGui
https://martin-fieber.de/blog/gui-develo.info: Comprehensive integration guide for Dear ImGui with SDL2, covering setup, performance optimization, High DPI support, and docking features. Demonstrates seamless integration with modern C++20 and CMake.

https://github.com/adamajammary/libsdl2g.title: libsdl2gui: Cross-platform User Interface Library
https://github.com/adamajammary/libsdl2g.info: Free, cross-platform UI library using SDL2 with C++20, XML-based UI definitions, and comprehensive component set. Latest version v1.4.0 with full event-driven architecture and platform-specific features.

https://www.forrestthewoods.com/blog/pro.title: Proving Immediate Mode GUIs are Performant
https://www.forrestthewoods.com/blog/pro.info: Performance analysis showing IMGUIs consume 7.5-8.2W on M1 MacBook Pro (comparable to retained mode UIs like VSCode at 7.0W). Demonstrates IMGUIs are highly efficient even under worst-case 120Hz conditions.

https://keasigmadelta.com/blog/building-.title: Building Cross-Platform C++ GUI with Raylib and Dear ImGui
https://keasigmadelta.com/blog/building-.info: Comparison of Raylib/raygui vs Dear ImGui approaches. Dear ImGui provides better performance and state management, while raygui offers simpler integration but with visual style limitations.

https://github.com/Immediate-Mode-UI/Nuk.title: Nuklear: Single-Header ANSI C GUI Library
https://github.com/Immediate-Mode-UI/Nuk.info: Minimal-state, immediate-mode GUI with 18kLOC, no dependencies, highly portable C89 implementation. Low memory footprint, total memory control, fully skinnable. 10.5k GitHub stars, excellent for real-time applications.

https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.title: Cataclysm-BN Main Repository
https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.info: Main repository structure, file organization, and project overview. Identified key directories (src/, data/, mods/) and build system configuration (CMake, Makefile). Shows C++ as primary language (92.3%) with comprehensive build support for multiple platforms.

https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.title: main.cpp - Entry Point and System Overview
https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.info: Core source code structure and organization. Identified key systems: game.cpp (main loop), savegame.cpp (persistence), input.cpp (input handling), ui.cpp (UI system), and cursesport.cpp (curses rendering). Shows breakdown of subsystems: game core, map management, entity management, scripting, rendering, input, and UI.

https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.title: game.cpp - Core Game State and Loop
https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.info: Game state management through the game class (singleton), UI system structure with uistate and ui_adaptor, screen management functions (do_turn, look_around, list_items, etc.), and data structures for game state including map, player, NPCs, and world management.

https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.title: input.cpp - Input Handling System
https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.info: Input event representation (input_event struct), global input manager (input_manager singleton), input contexts for different game modes, keybinding management (JSON format), action processing and dispatch, mouse and gamepad support, and Android-specific virtual controls.

https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.title: savegame.cpp - File I/O and Persistence
https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.info: Save/load system with JSON serialization format, savegame versioning (current version 28), file I/O using C++ streams, data structures for game state, overmap data, and legacy format support. Uses Run-Length Encoding for efficient storage and modular serialization architecture.

https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.title: ui.cpp - UI System and Menu Management
https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.info: UI system with uilist class for menu management, dynamic window sizing and positioning, text formatting and folding, hotkey support, filtering mechanisms, input context integration, and callback system for menu interactions.

https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.title: cursesport.cpp - ASCII Rendering and Terminal Handling
https://github.com/cataclysmbnteam/Catac.info: Curses rendering system for ASCII character display, window management with WINDOW struct, text storage in cursecell/cursecell structures, Unicode/UTF-8 character width handling, color and attribute management, and terminal output via external sdltiles.cpp module.
